result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Petar Zoric

records.addlTxt:
8:58 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. 
Defendant Petar Zoric in court.  Attorney McMurray for attorney Nicholas Martinez in court for Petar Zoric. 
Defense requests more time along with discovery and an offer. 
State will forward discovery.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

1:59 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.  Defendant Petar Zoric in court. 
Defendant does not have counsel at this time but has contacted counsel.  
Defendant requests a new date. 
Court will set a new date for status of counsel.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

10:39 AM Defendant Petar Zoric in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A appearing in court.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant to seek counsel.  Victim addresses the court.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on July 5, 2022
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
